intro: Sebastiania inopinata, commonly known as the red-seed sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Costa Rica, and Panama. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, red seeds. Sebastiania inopinata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
